transportAdvice: Stockholm has an extensive public transit network including metro, buses, trams, and ferries that reliably covers tourist areas and the city centre. The city is highly walkable in its central districts, and taxis are widely available though expensive.

weather.description: Cold, dark winter month with occasional snow and short daylight hours.
Still cold and wintry, though daylight begins to noticeably increase.
Early spring brings slightly milder temperatures but snow is still possible.
Spring arrives with longer days and fresh conditions, though evenings remain cool.
One of the most pleasant months, with mild warmth, blooming nature, and long daylight.
Warm and bright with near-midnight twilight, ideal for outdoor sightseeing.
The warmest month of the year with long sunny days and lively outdoor culture.
Still warm and enjoyable, with daylight beginning to shorten toward month's end.
Autumn sets in with cooler temperatures and beautiful foliage across the city.
Noticeably cooler and wetter, with grey skies and rapidly shortening days.
Cold and often damp, with limited daylight and the first frosts possible.
Dark and cold with festive Christmas markets brightening the winter atmosphere.
